info.title: Regionalised and Domain-specific Taxon Lists
info.description:
The DWB REST Webservice for Taxon Lists is part of a Diversity Workbench (DWB) services network. It is delivering basic information on taxon names in use, synonyms, classification and German vernacular names of a number of groups of animals, fungi and plants.

The current focus is on domain-specific lists (checklists, taxon reference lists, red lists) from Germany under active curation by experts on taxonomy or floristics and faunistics. Each regionalised and domain-specific taxon list has its own history and objectives, is managed completely separately and has its own hierarchical classification. The DiversityTaxonNames (DTN) data resources accessed by the REST API may include additional taxon-related data useful, e. g., for regional nature conservation agencies and environmental projects. This information might be mobilised in a next step.

For more information please check Overview on Published Lists. For details refer to DTN_Taxon_Lists_Services

Regionalisierte und domän-spezifische Taxonlisten

Der DWB REST Webservice for Taxon Lists ist Teil eines Netzwerkes aus Diversity Workbench (DWB) Diensten. Er liefert Basisinformation zu anerkannten Taxonnamen, Synonymen, Klassifikationen und deutsche Volksnamen für eine Anzahl von Tier-, Pilz- und Pflanzengruppen.

Der Fokus liegt dabei zur Zeit auf domän-spezifischen Listen (Checklisten, Taxonreferenzlisten und Rote Listen) aus Deutschland, die von taxonomisch oder floristisch bzw. faunistisch arbeitenden Experten aktiv kuratiert werden. Jede regionalisierte und domän-spezifische Taxonliste hat ihre eigene Geschichte und Zielvorstellungen, wird separat gemanagt und hat ihre eine eigenständige hierarchische Klassifikation. Die über die REST API zugänglichen DiversityTaxonNames (DTN) Datenquellen können weitere taxon-bezogene Daten enthalten, die für regionale Naturschutzeinrichtungen und Umweltprojekte von Bedeutung sein können. Diese Information soll in einem nächsten Schritt mobilisiert werden.

Die derzeit veröffentlichten Listen sind in dieser Übersicht abrufbar. Weitere Information findet sich unter DTN_Taxon_Lists_Services

REST API Documentation

get.description:
Full text search on names

The search covers the fields:

  • TaxonNameCache
  • CommonName
  • CountryCode
  • DatabaseName

Use ~N to allow N uncertain letters: colo~2 will search everything by exchanging two letters in colo: colo, coco, cora, ...

Additional search possiblities with:

  • Search for NameID with the parameter nameid.
  • Search for exact matches in attribute TaxonNameCache with parameter exactname.

      • Parameters should not be used together in one query. One parameter has to be given..

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Text to search

parameters.name: exactname
parameters.description: Exact name to search in field TaxonNameCache

parameters.name: nameid
parameters.description: NameID to search for in all lists

parameters.name: exactnamepartwithoutauthorandyear
parameters.description: Search only for the first part of a name without authors and year. Only exact matches are returned.

200.description: An list of usrls to the name specifications

get.description: Get one taxonomic name data set

parameters.name: database
parameters.description: database name

parameters.name: nameid
parameters.description: database unique id of the taxonomic name

200.description: An Array with one item, representing, the taxonomic name dataset

get.description: get a list of links to corresponding common names for this taxonomic name

parameters.name: database
parameters.description: database name

parameters.name: nameid
parameters.description: database unique id of the taxonomic name

200.description: An array with links to the common names or an empty array if no common names are stored

get.description: A list of links to accepted names for this taxonomic name

parameters.name: nameid

get.summary: links to all taxonomic names in this specific list

get.description: Links to all projects on this server. Not implemented.

200.description: returns allways null

get.description: An array with the datasets and links to all relations on the literature reference. \ Mostly the author list of the reference. \ The links are only for referencing an specific relation.

parameters.description: database name

parameters.name: referenceid

get.description: An array with the datasets and links to all relations on the literature reference. \ Mostly the author list of the reference.

parameters.name: databaseid
parameters.description: database name

parameters.name: referenceid
parameters.description: database unique id of the reference

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: role of the relation, like aut for author.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: sequence number of the reference, like number of the author

200.description: An array with one relation to the specific literature reference

url.description: Link/url to the found taxonomic name

TaxonomicRank.description: Taxonomic rank, according to the DisplayText field of the code-ENUM

links.description: Links to common names, accepted names, synonyms, hierarchies and the list project
Link to the refering taxonamic name
Project link to the project description in which this name is defined as an accepted name
Link to the name dataset of the synonym

NameID.description: NameID of the current parent or the starting name when level==0

NameParentID.description: NameID of the parent of this entry

TaxonomicRank.description: Taxonomic rank of this parent, according to the DisplayText-code-ENUM in the database

baseNameID.description: NameID of the base name for which this parent query was startet

level.description: Sort order for this parent list. 0 is the starting name, 1 the first parent, 2 the parent of the parent, a.s.o.

links.description: Links to the parent name and the hierarchy defining project
Links to the parent name and the hierarchy defining project
Relations links for the reference, containing roles like author

link.description: referenceRelation links for the reference role and sequence
